step_feedback.feedback: Good job maintaining a comfortable seated or standing posture.  Remember to focus on inhaling deeply through your nose, visualizing the fluid moving towards your chest. Your muscle engagement seems consistent across repetitions.
You successfully placed your hands on your abdomen.  Ensure you are focusing on the sensation of your abdomen rising and falling with each breath.  Consistent hand placement is key for this step.

While you're inhaling deeply, try to engage your whole body muscles more effectively.  The instructions mention tightening your whole body muscles during inhalation; focus on this aspect to improve lymphatic stimulation. Visualizing the fluid movement will enhance the exercise's effectiveness.

The exhale needs more focus on relaxing your muscles and visualizing the fluid being pushed out.  Concentrate on a slow, controlled exhale through your mouth to maximize lymphatic drainage.  The variation in wrist movement between repetitions suggests inconsistent muscle relaxation.

exercise_summary: The patient demonstrated good posture and hand placement during the exercise.  However, there's room for improvement in fully engaging whole body muscles during inhalation and completely relaxing them during exhalation.  Focusing on the visualization techniques and ensuring consistent muscle engagement throughout will significantly enhance the exercise's benefits.
